questions.title: Official Arkansas Driver License Practice Test
questions.description:
The practice test generates 25 questions randomly chosen from a larger group of questions extracted from the Arkansas State Police driver license knowledge test and questions from the Arkansas State Police Driver License Study Guide.
The study guide provided by the Arkansas State Police is the exclusive fundamental source of information needed to pass the driver license written test.
This practice quiz is not a substitute for the study guide booklet.
If a test applicant expects to pass the actual test administered by the state police, it will be necessary for the applicant to read the study guide and completely comprehend the rules of the road.
You can repeat the practice test as often as you want. Each new test will generate another set of 25 questions.
Once you have finished, a screen will appear showing your test results.
questions.notice: The practice quiz is only a resource tool used to enhance the applicant’s study preparations. Applicants must read the study guide if they expect to pass the actual test.

question.text: The body rids itself at the rate of:
The only octagon shaped (8 sides) traffic sign is a:
Parking lights may only be used:

answers.answer: While driving in snow, rain or fog

question.text: Pedestrians carrying a white cane or using a guide dog must be:

answers.answer: Told when to cross the street
Given the absolute right of way with a traffic control device

question.text: Which of the following vehicles is required to stop at a railroad crossing:
The only thing that will sober you up is:
Most skids are caused by:
This sign indicates:

answers.answer: Aircraft is ready for take off

question.text: This sign means:
When approaching a stop sign or stop line you must:

answers.answer: At the stop line, if present
Out far enough to see around obstacles

question.text: This sign means:
A red arrow on a traffic light means:

answers.answer: You may turn in the direction of the arrow after a complete stop
You may not turn in the direction of the arrow
You may turn in the direction of the arrow after a complete stop and no opposing traffic

question.text: A solid double yellow line in the center of the roadway:

answers.answer: Marks passing is prohibited for vehicles traveling in either direction
Marks the center turn lane for vehicles traveling in either direction
Must not be crossed to turn

question.text: Worn tires can cause your car to:
Being a safe driver depends on you:
The safest speed to drive in traffic is:

answers.answer: Faster than the flow of traffic
Slower than the flow of traffic

question.text: This sign means:
The three (3) types of distractions are Cognitive, Visual and ____________________.
A curb that is painted red indicates:
How many alcoholic drinks does it take to affect your driving:
You should always park your vehicle more than 18 inches from the curb

answer.explanation: You should never park more than 18 inches from the curb

question.text: When can a driver turn right on a red traffic light:

answers.answer: After you stop and check for opposing traffic
As soon as you approach the light

question.text: Children must be secured in a child safety seat until:
Before you start driving you should:
How should your hands be placed on the steering wheel:

answers.answer: Side by side on the bottom

question.text: Before making a lane change you should only check your side mirrors:

answer.explanation: Drivers should check rear view mirror, side mirrors and look over the shoulder

question.text: You should not pass another vehicle if you are within 1/3 mile of a curve or hill?
How many feet would you need to stop if you were traveling at 55 mph:
Warning signs are:
What should you do if your motor stops while you are driving:

answers.answer: Keep a strong hold on the wheel and pull off the highway
Grip the wheel and apply the brake firmly
Apply your emergency brake and stop the vehicle

question.text: Arkansas fines for speeding in a highway work zone are:

answers.answer: Tripled with an immediate suspension of your driving privileges

question.text: You should use your brakes before entering a curve?
When your vehicle begins to hydroplane you should keep your speed down?
You are approaching a police car with its emergency lights flashing, you should:

answers.answer: Move to the lane closest to the police vehicle
Move to the left shoulder and stop
Move to the lane furthest from the police vehicle

question.text: If convicted of a first offense alcohol conviction, your fines will be $1,000 to $5,000 plus court cost?
You should never park within 15 feet of a fire hydrant?
When changing lanes you should always check your mirrors and look over your shoulder
A school bus is stopped with its warning lights flashing, you must:

answers.answer: Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop and wait until the lights are turned off
Yield until the lights are turned off

question.text: When raining, hot pavement can become slippery:

answers.answer: After it's rained for a few hours

question.text: You are approaching an intersection with a flashing red light, you should:

answers.answer: Wait until the light turns green and proceed
Stop and check for traffic and then proceed with caution.

question.text: The applicant with an instruction permit may drive with a licensed driver:

answers.answer: Twenty-one (21) years of age or older, who is occupying a seat beside the driver.
Eighteen (18) years of age or older, who is occupying a seat beside the driver.

question.text: A motorcycle permit does not require a licensed driver?
If an applicant is between the age of fourteen (14) and sixteen (16), a six (6) month driving restriction could be placed on the license?
The learners license will restrict the applicant until the:

answers.answer: No restriction is required for a learners license
Eighteenth (18th) birthday AND the six (6) months of restricted driving is complete
Sixteenth (16th) birthday AND the six (6) months of restricted driving is complete

question.text: When the applicant turns sixteen, no restriction is required as long as he/she held a permit for six (6) months prior to being licensed.
Arkansas law makes it illegal to drive, or to be a front-seat passenger, without wearing safety belts?
When there are no signs or lane markings to control turning, a driver should :

answers.answer: Turn into the lane closest to the lane of travel
Turn into the lane farthest from the lane of travel
Chose a lane without opposing traffic

question.text: When passing a tractor trailer, you should always pass on the left?
A person shall not knowingly smoke tobacco in any motor vehicle in which a child:

answers.answer: Who is less than fourteen (14) years of age is a passenger
Who is less than thirteen (13) years of age is a passenger
Who is less than five (5) years of age is a passenger

question.text: More than half of the crashes that cause injury or death happen at speeds:

answers.answer: More than 40 mph within 25 miles from home.
Less than 40 mph and within 25 miles from home.
Less than 55 mph within 10 miles of the home.

question.text: The shoulder harness should not be worn:
The lap belt should be adjusted so that it is loose and lies low across your hips after fastening.
The fine for a first offense of Littering in Arkansas is:

answers.answer: A fine of up to $250, court costs and voluntary community service.
A fine of up to $500 and not more than twenty-four hours of community service.
A fine of up to $1,000 and not more than eight hours of community service.

question.text: You should never leave children and pets unattended in a vehicle?

Though we may think prior air-conditioning will help to keep the car cool after exiting, you should know that within five minutes on a 90-degree day, the temperature within a vehicle reaches that of the outdoors, and for every nine (9) minutes the interior temperature increases:
Signs in work areas are typically diamond shaped, orange, displaying black letters or symbols, and serve as a warning that people are working on or near the highway.
This sign means:
If you are approaching a flashing yellow light you should:

answers.answer: Slow down and proceed with caution
Apply accelerator and proceed through the intersection

question.text: A steady red arrow mean:

answers.answer: You may turn in the direction of the arrow after making a complete stop
Yield to oncoming traffic then turn in the direction of the arrow
The driver turning left must stop

question.text: If you are in a turn lane and there is a traffic arrow for your lane on the traffic light, you should make your turn after the green arrow has appeared and it is safe to do so?
A driver is on a one way street, turning from the left lane onto another one way street. The driver should:

answers.answer: Enter the lane that is further from the driver
Enter the lane based on where the driver plans to turn
Enter the lane that is closest to driver

question.text: A speed limit indicates the minimum and maximum speed allowed for a particular section of highway or street?
The maximum speed limit should be used in any conditions and you are not required to reduce speeds when a condition arises such as slippery roads or poor visibility.

answer.explanation: The maximum speed should be reduced according to road conditions.

question.text: The do not enter sign means:
This sign means:

answers.answer: Vehicles are traveling slower than the normal speed
A vehicle is traveling the same speed as other vehicles
Vehicles are traveling faster than the normal speed

question.text: Railroad crossing warning signs are used to warn drivers of :
A white “X” shaped sign with black letters means:

answers.answer: This sign marks the grade crossing and requires you to stop.
This sign marks the grade crossing and requires you to yield the right-of-way to the train.
This sign marks the grade crossing and requires you to cross the tracks without stopping.

question.text: You are approaching railroad tracks with red flashing lights, you should:

answers.answer: Not cross the tracks because a train is present and the gates are about to close.
You should look quickly and cross without hesitation
Stop, look and listen, then cross the tracks with caution

question.text: This sign means:

answers.answer: Provides critical emergency contact information at every highway-rail grade crossing.
Provides the public with critical emergency contact information at dangerous intersections
Provides all railroad workers with emergency contact information in case of an accident

question.text: A sign (below the cross buck) with white background and black letters that says 'EXEMPT' means:

answers.answer: The tracks have been abandoned or discontinued, but you must watch for the possibility of a train
The tracks have been abandoned or discontinued and there is no possibility of a train
This is for railroad use only and does not concern the driver

question.text: When approaching a railroad crossing, look up and down the track to make sure a train is not approaching.
Always expect a train. Never assume a train is not coming even if you haven’t seen one at a particular crossing.
You should always attempt to beat a train to avoid a crash:
This sign means:
This sign means:
This sign means:
This sign means:
This sign means:
A solid white line along the side of the roadway that tells the driver where the outer edge is located.
A dashed white line between lanes of traffic indicates a driver may :

answers.answer: May not cross the line to change lanes
May cross the line to change lanes, only when a sign allows
May cross the line to change lanes, when safe

question.text: A solid white line between lanes of traffic indicates:

answers.answer: A driver can cross the line to change lanes
A driver cannot cross the line to change lanes
A driver can cross the line to change lanes only when safe to do so

question.text: A shared turn lane is marked on each side by a solid yellow line and yellow dashed lines.
A driver may use the shared center lane to accelerate into traffic:
On a road with three or more lanes traveling in the same direction, a driver should:

answers.answer: Remain in the right lane except to pass
Stay in the left lane to keep the flow of traffic
Switch lanes constantly to accommodate approaching drivers.

question.text: A driver should never drive on the shoulder of any street or road, unless directed by a police officer.
When passing on a multi-lane road, you should use which lane to pass a vehicle:
When there are no signs or lane markings to control turning, a driver should:

answers.answer: Turn into the lane further to the direction of travel
Turn into either lane depending on when you want to turn
Turn into the lane closest to the direction of travel.

question.text: Drivers turning left must turn immediately without yielding to oncoming traffic

answer.explanation: Drivers turning left must always yield to oncoming traffic.

question.text: Drivers entering a traffic circle or rotary (roundabout) do not yield to drivers already in the circle

answer.explanation: Drivers must always yield to vehicle in the roundabout.

question.text: At an intersection where there is no stop sign or traffic signal, drivers must yield to:
At “3 WAY”, “4 WAY and an “ALL WAY” stop sign, the driver reaching the intersection first, goes first, after making a complete stop.
Arkansas law requires motorists to _______ for police cars, fire trucks, ambulances and other emergency vehicles using a siren or air horn, and a red or blue flashing light.

answers.answer: Stay in your lane and proceed with caution

question.text: Arkansas State Law allows motorist to use a “rolling stop” at a stop sign if there is no opposing traffic?

answer.explanation: Arkansas State Law requires motorist to make a complete stop.

question.text: The driver must never attempt to pass in any direction until the school bus has finished receiving or discharging its passengers and begins moving without its red lights flashing.
Drivers passing a stopped school bus with red lights flashing upon conviction will be

answers.answer: Charged with a Misdemeanor and a minimum fine of $250 not to exceed $1000, up to ninety (90) days jail and/or both.
Charged with a Felony and a minimum fine of $1000 not to exceed $5000, up to a year in jail.

question.text: A person who violates Issac’s law is subject to a Class C Felony, for negligent homicide if he or she negligently causes the death of another person.

In order to park in an handicapped accessible parking space, you must have either the appropriate license plate with the international symbol or the designated hang tag often referred to as a 'Special Certificate'?
When parking in a handicap parking space, you can use another person’s “special certificate” to park your vehicle as long as you are disabled.
The registered owner of the special certificate or vehicle with the appropriate license plate must exit the vehicle when utilizing a designated space.
The issued or endorsed photo identification card is not required when using an accessible parking space.
Arkansas law requires drivers to turn on their headlights when windshield wipers are needed:
You can reduce the time it takes to stop your vehicle by:

answers.answer: Adjusting your speed to the road conditions

question.text: On a wet road you should reduce your speed by ____mph?
Going much slower than other vehicles traveling in the same direction can be just as bad as speeding?
When merging in traffic, you should keep your speed:

answers.answer: The same speed as other vehicles

question.text: When a driver behind you wants to pass, you should:

answers.answer: Speed up to allow proper flow of traffic
Stop and pull over to allow the vehicle to safely pass
Slow down to allow room in front of your vehicle to allow the passing vehicle to safely merge

question.text: An excellent rule for motorists sharing the road with a tractor-trailer is, “if you can’t see the truck driver in the tractor side mirror, the driver can’t see you.”
Bicycles have the same rights and responsibilities on the streets as other vehicles, and must share lanes of traffic.
Bicycles are required to travel on the left hand side of the road with other traffic.

answer.explanation: Bicycles must travel on the right hand side

question.text: If you see a bicyclist with a red or orange pennant flag attached to the bike, slow down; this is a symbol to indicate the rider has impaired hearing.
If you have a restriction “B” (must wear contacts or glasses) on your driver license, you must drive with your eye wear.
If you are pulled over for drinking and driving, the law enforcement officer can choose which test (saliva, breath or urine) to request.
If you refuse a Breath, Urine or Saliva Test upon request of a law enforcement officer, you can lose your license:
If you are found guilty of an alcohol violation and it is first conviction, you could be fined:

answers.answer: $500 to $5000, in addition to court costs and up to one (1) year in jail
$150 to $1000, in addition to court costs and up to one (1) year in jail
$500 to $1000, in addition to court costs and up to one (1) year in jail

question.text: In Arkansas, you cannot buy or consume alcohol under the age of:
If you are found guilty of a DUI after proper test(s), you could have your license revoked until you reach twenty-one (21) years of age and you could be fined $2000.
If you have a faulty accelerator (gas pedal) and your motor begins to run faster, you should:

answers.answer: Apply your emergency brake and get off the highway as soon as possible
Pump your brake to stop the vehicle
Shift to neutral, pull over and turn the engine off

question.text: You are preparing for a skills (driving portion) exam, you will need:

answers.answer: Permit, Insurance, Registration and a license driver twenty-one (21) years or older.

question.text: I am required to know vehicle controls for my skill exam.
When I appear for my skills (driving portion) exam, my vehicle can be dirty and not mechanically sound.

answer.explanation: Vehicles must be mechanically sound and clean.

question.text: I am allowed to drive myself to the testing center without a licensed driver?

answer.explanation: All applicants with a learners permit must be accompanied by a licensed driver twenty-one (21) years or older.

question.text: A violation of any law may result in a failing grade on the skills test.
